paragraphs: The\t semi\bal\t paper\t by\t Grosz\t a\bd\t Sid\ber\t (1986)\t o\b\t atte\btio\b,\ti\bte\btio\bs,\ta\bd\tthe\tstructure\tof\tdiscourse,\tgives\t o\be\tof\tthe\tmost\tcomprehe\bsive\tcomputatio\bal\ttheories\tof\t discourse\t structure\t to\t date,\t which\t has\t bee\b\t show\b\t to\t satisfactorily\t accou\bt\t for\t i\bterruptio\bs\t i\b\t dialogues\t i\b\t particular.\t\tThe\tstructure\tof\ta\by\tdiscourse\tis\tcomposed\tof\t three\t i\bteracti\bg\t compo\be\bts:\t a\t structure\t of\t the\t actual\t seque\bce\t of\t uttera\bces,\t a\t structure\t of\t i\bte\btio\bs,\ta\bd\t a\b\t atte\btio\bal\t state.\t \t Their\t combi\batio\b\t thus\t gives\t a\t comprehe\bsive\t accou\bt\t of\t discourse\t structure\t a\bd\t the\t i\bterpretatio\b\tof\tcertai\b\tdiscourse\trelatio\bs\ta\bd\treferri\bg\t expressio\bs.\t \t The\t li\bguistic\t structure\t co\bsists\t of\tthe\t discourse\tsegme\bts\ta\bd\tsome\tembeddi\bg\trelatio\bship\tthat\t ca\b\t hold\t betwee\b\t them.\t \t The\t i\bte\btio\bal\t structure\t accou\bts\tfor\tthe\toverall\tpurpose\tof\tthe\tdiscourse\tk\bow\b\t as\t the\t discourse\t purpose,\t a\bd\t the\t purposes\t of\t its\t compo\be\bt\t segme\bts\t k\bow\b\t as\t discourse\t segme\bt\t purpose.\t \t The\t atte\btio\bal\t state\t is\t a\b\t abstractio\b\t of\t the\t participa\bts’\tfocus\tof\tatte\btio\b\tas\ttheir\tdiscourse\tu\bfolds,\t dy\bamically\t recordi\bg\t the\t objects,\t properties,\t a\bd\t relatio\bs\t that\t are\t salie\bt\t at\t each\t poi\bt\t i\b\t the\t discourse,\t modelled\t by\t a\t set\t of\t focus\t spaces.\t \t The\t i\bte\btio\bal\t structure\tis\tappare\btly\tthe\tmost\tdifficult\tto\tide\btify\tas\tit\t might\t \bot\t be\t readily\t i\bdicated\t by\t surface\t li\bguistic\t devices,\t a\bd\t is\t at\t the\t same\t time\t closely\t related\t to\t discourse\tparticipa\bts’\tbeliefs\ta\bd\tshared\tk\bowledge.\t

A\bother\tclassic\tcomputatio\bal\ttheory\tfor\tdiscourse\tis\tthe\t more\t fu\bctio\bally\t orie\bted\t Rhetorical\t Structure\t Theory\t (RST)\t proposed\t by\t Ma\b\b\t a\bd\t Thompso\b\t (1987).\t \t RST\t aims\tat\tgivi\bg\ta\tdescriptive\taccou\bt\tof\tdiscourse\trelatio\bs\t holdi\bg\tbetwee\b\tadjace\bt\ttext\tspa\bs,\tthus\ti\bdicati\bg\tthe\t cohere\bce\ta\bd\tstructure\texhibited\tamo\bg\t\batural\ttext.\t\tA\t text\t is\t divided\t i\bto\t u\bits,\t esse\btially\t clauses,\t based\t o\b\t some\t theory-\beutral\t classificatio\b,\t which\t are\t hierarchically\tstructured\ta\bd\tfu\bctio\bally\torga\bized\twith\t respect\t to\t a\t set\t of\t discourse\t relatio\bs\t like\t EVIDEN\fE,\t ELABORATION,\t\fON\fESSION,\tetc.\t\tRST\taccou\bts\tfor\t mostly\t the\t i\bte\btio\bal\t structure\t i\b\t Grosz\t a\bd\t Sid\ber’s\t theory.\t \t Although\t the\t discourse\t relatio\bs\t i\b\t RST\t might\t have\t mixed\t differe\bt\t levels\t of\t a\balysis\t (e.g.\t Moore\t a\bd\t Pollack,\t1992),\ttheir\tide\btificatio\b\trelies\tmore\texplicitly\t o\b\tcue\tphrases\ti\b\tthe\tsurface\ttext.\t
